DOC.brief_summary: The Left interscalene block has a different effect on heart's autonomic nervous system, compared to Right interscalene block. This effect is evident on the occurrence of bradycardia and hypotension during shoulder surgery in the beach chair position
DOC.brief_title: Effect of the Side of Interscalene Block on Bradycardia and Hypotension in Beach Chair Position
DOC.criteria: elective shoulder surgery Age 50 80 years old ASA II IV Coagulopathy disorders Infection at the puncture site for the interscalene block Neurological deficit on the side to be operated Allergy to local anesthetics Psychiatric disorders Patient's refusal Problems with patient communication Failure of the interscalene block
